about_me: Hello, my name is Héctor. I am a computer systems engineer focused on front-end web development. My goal is to contribute and apply my knowledge in transforming ideas into functional digital experiences, as well as to continue growing alongside the team or company I work with, improving these skills and continuing to learn new approaches along the way.
project3_description: Twitch bot to moderate my own channel using the Twitch tmi API
project3_content: I developed a web application in React with TypeScript and CSS, integrated with Twitch's TMI API, to create a custom moderation bot that automates tasks on my Twitch channel. Later, I converted the application into a Windows desktop app using Electron, achieving a stable solution.
project4_description: Virtual Reality environment inspired by a real classroom at my university
project4_content: Development of a Virtual Reality environment using OpenSpace3D, where I created a 3D model of a real university space, as well as interactive scenes aimed at exploring the environment. The project included the integration of interaction devices such as an Xbox controller and Myo armband, allowing control of movement and navigation within the virtual reality application.
project5_description: Web application for note management, allowing you to create, edit, and organize notes with sections, attach other notes and documents, and manage users through authentication
project5_content:
Web application for note management, focused on the organization and connection of information. It allows creating, editing, and structuring notes through sections, attaching related notes, and associating documents with each note, as well as featuring a user authentication system (registration and login) integrated with an API. 

I developed the frontend entirely myself, including the interface design, user experience, and implementation of key functionalities such as document upload via drag and drop, state management, and validations. 

On the backend, I worked with NestJS and Docker, making small corrections to the existing system and developing all the necessary logic for uploading, managing, and associating documents with the notes.
